Viewing Surfaces

Bradley Buchsbaum

2018-08-21

Source: vignettes/viewing-surfaces.Rmd
viewing-surfaces.Rmd

Plotting a Cortical Surface


white_surf <- read_surf(white_lh_asc)
#> loading /Users/bbuchsbaum/code/neurosurf/inst/testdata/std.40.lh.smoothwm.asc
white_rh_surf <-  read_surf(white_rh_asc)
#> loading /Users/bbuchsbaum/code/neurosurf/inst/testdata/std.40.rh.smoothwm.asc
p <- plot(white_surf)
rglwidget()

preservef8ecd89a905779c8


white_rh_surf <- read_surf(white_rh_asc)
#> loading /Users/bbuchsbaum/code/neurosurf/inst/testdata/std.40.rh.smoothwm.asc

Plotting two surfaces side by side


white_surf <- read_surf(white_lh_asc)
#> loading /Users/bbuchsbaum/code/neurosurf/inst/testdata/std.40.lh.smoothwm.asc
inflated_surf <- read_surf(inflated_lh_asc)
#> loading /Users/bbuchsbaum/code/neurosurf/inst/testdata/std.40.lh.inflated.asc

inflated_rh_surf <- read_surf(inflated_rh_asc)
#> loading /Users/bbuchsbaum/code/neurosurf/inst/testdata/std.40.rh.inflated.asc


open3d()
#> glX 
#>   3
mfrow3d(1, 2, byrow = TRUE)

p <- plot(white_surf)
next3d()
p2 <- plot(inflated_surf)
rglwidget()

preserve9187497d96660cba

Smoothing surface geometry



open3d()
#> glX 
#>   5
layout3d(matrix(1:6, 2,3), heights=c(1,3))
t1 <- text3d(0,0,0,"taubin smooth, lambda=.12"); next3d()
white_surf1 <- smooth(white_surf, type="taubin", lambda=.9)
p1 <- plot(white_surf1); next3d()

t2 <- text3d(0,0,0,"taubin smooth, lambda=.8"); next3d()
white_surf2 <- smooth(white_surf, type="taubin", lambda=.7)
p2 <- plot(white_surf2); next3d()

t3 <- text3d(0,0,0,"taubin smooth, lambda=.4"); next3d()
white_surf3 <- smooth(white_surf, type="taubin", lambda=.5)
p3 <- plot(white_surf3); 

rglwidget()

preservedcb284eb737e59d9

Adding a Color Layer to a Surface

Here we add a colors to the surface that are a function of each surface nodeâ€™s x coordinate. When then map these values to a rainbow color map.


open3d()
#> glX 
#>   7
xvals <- white_surf1@mesh$vb[1,]
p <- plot(white_surf1, vals=xvals, cmap=rainbow(255))
rglwidget()

preserve0814d0f29ab42537

Showing the curvature of a surface


open3d()
#> glX 
#>   9
curv <- curvature(white_surf1)
curv <- ifelse(curv > median(curv), 1, 0)
p <- plot(white_surf1, bgcol=curv_cols(curv))
rglwidget()

preserve8f98b56abe414e8f

Showing an activation on a surface


open3d()
#> glX 
#>  11
mfrow3d(1, 2, byrow = TRUE)
vals <- rnorm(length(nodes(white_surf1)))
surf <- NeuroSurface(white_surf1, indices=1:length(vals), data=vals)
ssurf <- smooth(smooth(surf))
p <- plot(ssurf@geometry, vals=ssurf@data, cmap=rainbow(100), irange=c(-2,2), thresh=c(-.2, .2))

next3d()
comp <- conn_comp(ssurf, threshold=c(-.2,.2))
vals <- ssurf@data
vals[comp$size@data < 100] <- 0
p2 <- plot(ssurf@geometry, vals=vals, cmap=rainbow(100), irange=c(-2,2), thresh=c(-.2, .2))

rglwidget()

preserve256fe4dbd89cc462 ## Showing an activation overlaid on a curvature map



open3d()
#> glX 
#>  13
curv <- curvature(white_surf1)

vals <- rnorm(length(nodes(white_surf1)))
surf <- NeuroSurface(white_surf1, indices=1:length(vals), data=vals)
ssurf <- smooth(smooth(surf))


p <- plot(white_surf1, vals=ssurf@data, bgcol=curv_cols(curv),cmap=rainbow(100), irange=c(-2,2), thresh=c(-.3, .3))
rglwidget()

preservef25c25c45d35f812

Changing lighting, background and specular color



open3d()
#> glX 
#>  15
bg3d("black")
mfrow3d(nc=3, nr=1)

p <- plot(white_surf1, bgcol=curv_cols(curv), lit=TRUE); next3d()
p <- plot(white_surf1, bgcol=curv_cols(curv), lit=FALSE); next3d()
p <- plot(white_surf1, bgcol=curv_cols(curv), lit=TRUE, specular="white");

rglwidget()

preserve6519faeb4edfd8c3

Showing two hemisperes in same scene


open3d()
#> glX 
#>  17
curv_lh <- curvature(white_surf1)

white_rh_surf1 <- smooth(white_rh_surf, type="taubin", lambda=.9)
curv_rh <- curvature(white_rh_surf1)

p <- plot(white_surf1, bgcol=curv_cols(curv_lh), viewpoint="posterior")
p <- plot(white_rh_surf1,bgcol=curv_cols(curv_rh), viewpoint="posterior")
rglwidget()

preserveb841fc0e4997c5a6
